name: OOZIE
comment: This is comment for OOZIE service

properties.name: oozie.base.url
properties.description: Base Oozie URL.

properties.name: oozie.system.id
properties.description: The Oozie system ID.

properties.name: oozie.systemmode
properties.description: System mode for Oozie at startup.

properties.name: oozie.delete.runtime.dir.on.shutdown
properties.description: If the runtime directory should be kept after Oozie shutdowns down.

properties.name: oozie.services
properties.value:
org.apache.oozie.service.SchedulerService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.InstrumentationService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.CallableQueueService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.UUIDService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.ELService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.AuthorizationService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.MemoryLocksService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.DagXLogInfoService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.SchemaService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.LiteWorkflowAppService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.JPAService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.StoreService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.CoordinatorStoreService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.SLAStoreService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.DBLiteWorkflowStoreService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.CallbackService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.ActionService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.ActionCheckerService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.RecoveryService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.PurgeService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.CoordinatorEngineService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.BundleEngineService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.DagEngineService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.CoordMaterializeTriggerService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.StatusTransitService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.PauseTransitService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.GroupsService,
      org.apache.oozie.service.ProxyUserService
properties.description:
All services to be created and managed by Oozie Services singleton.
      Class names must be separated by commas.

properties.name: oozie.service.ConfigurationService.ignore.system.properties
properties.description:
Specifies "oozie.*" properties to cannot be overridden via Java system properties.
      Property names must be separted by commas.

properties.name: oozie.service.SchedulerService.threads
properties.description:
The number of threads to be used by the SchedulerService to run deamon tasks.
      If maxed out, scheduled daemon tasks will be queued up and delayed until threads become available.

properties.name: oozie.service.AuthorizationService.authorization.enabled
properties.description:
Specifies whether security (user name/admin role) is enabled or not.
      If disabled any user can manage Oozie system and manage any job.

properties.name: oozie.service.AuthorizationService.default.group.as.acl
properties.description: Enables old behavior where the User's default group is the job's ACL.

properties.name: oozie.service.InstrumentationService.logging.interval
properties.description:
Interval, in seconds, at which instrumentation should be logged by the InstrumentationService.
      If set to 0 it will not log instrumentation data.

properties.name: oozie.service.PurgeService.older.than
properties.description: Completed workflow jobs older than this value, in days, will be purged by the PurgeService.

properties.name: oozie.service.PurgeService.coord.older.than
properties.description: Completed coordinator jobs older than this value, in days, will be purged by the PurgeService.

properties.name: oozie.service.PurgeService.bundle.older.than
properties.description: Completed bundle jobs older than this value, in days, will be purged by the PurgeService.

properties.name: oozie.service.PurgeService.purge.limit
properties.description: Completed Actions purge - limit each purge to this value

properties.name: oozie.service.PurgeService.purge.interval
properties.description: Interval at which the purge service will run, in seconds.

properties.name: oozie.service.RecoveryService.wf.actions.older.than
properties.description: Age of the actions which are eligible to be queued for recovery, in seconds.

properties.name: oozie.service.RecoveryService.callable.batch.size
properties.description:
This value determines the number of callable which will be batched together
      to be executed by a single thread.

properties.name: oozie.service.RecoveryService.interval
properties.description: Interval at which the RecoverService will run, in seconds.

properties.name: oozie.service.RecoveryService.coord.older.than
properties.description: Age of the Coordinator jobs or actions which are eligible to be queued for recovery, in seconds.

properties.name: oozie.service.RecoveryService.bundle.older.than
properties.description: Age of the Bundle jobs which are eligible to be queued for recovery, in seconds.

properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.queue.size
properties.description: Max callable queue size

properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.threads
properties.description: Number of threads used for executing callables

properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.callable.concurrency
properties.description:
Maximum concurrency for a given callable type.
      Each command is a callable type (submit, start, run, signal, job, jobs, suspend,resume, etc).
      Each action type is a callable type (Map-Reduce, Pig, SSH, FS, sub-workflow, etc).
      All commands that use action executors (action-start, action-end, action-kill and action-check) use
      the action type as the callable type.

properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.callable.next.eligible
properties.description:
If true, when a callable in the queue has already reached max concurrency,
      Oozie continuously find next one which has not yet reach max concurrency.

properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.InterruptMapMaxSize
properties.description: Maximum Size of the Interrupt Map, the interrupt element will not be inserted in the map if exceeded the size.

properties.name: oozie.service.CallableQueueService.InterruptTypes
properties.description: Getting the types of XCommands that are considered to be of Interrupt type

properties.name: oozie.service.CoordMaterializeTriggerService.lookup.interval
properties.description:
Coordinator Job Lookup trigger command is scheduled at
      this "interval" (in seconds).

properties.name: oozie.service.CoordMaterializeTriggerService.materialization.window
properties.description:
Coordinator Job Lookup command materialized each job for
      this next "window" duration

properties.name: oozie.service.CoordMaterializeTriggerService.callable.batch.size
properties.description:
This value determines the number of callable which will be batched together
      to be executed by a single thread.

properties.name: oozie.service.CoordMaterializeTriggerService.materialization.system.limit
properties.description: This value determines the number of coordinator jobs to be materialized at a given time.

properties.name: oozie.service.coord.normal.default.timeout
properties.description: Default timeout for a coordinator action input check (in minutes) for normal job.

properties.name: oozie.service.coord.default.max.timeout
properties.description: Default maximum timeout for a coordinator action input check (in minutes). 86400= 60days

properties.name: oozie.service.coord.input.check.requeue.interval
properties.description: Command re-queue interval for coordinator data input check (in millisecond).

properties.name: oozie.service.coord.default.concurrency
properties.description:
Default concurrency for a coordinator job to determine how many maximum action should
      be executed at the same time. -1 means infinite concurrency.

properties.name: oozie.service.coord.default.throttle
properties.description:
Default throttle for a coordinator job to determine how many maximum action should
      be in WAITING state at the same time.

properties.name: oozie.service.coord.materialization.throttling.factor
properties.description:
Determine how many maximum actions should be in WAITING state for a single job at any time. The value
      is calculated by
      this factor X the total queue size.

properties.name: oozie.service.ELService.groups
properties.description: List of groups for different ELServices

properties.name: oozie.service.ELService.constants.workflow
properties.description: EL constant declarations, separated by commas, format is [PREFIX:]NAME=CLASS#CONSTANT.

properties.name: oozie.service.ELService.functions.workflow
properties.description: EL functions declarations, separated by commas, format is [PREFIX:]NAME=CLASS#METHOD.

properties.name: oozie.service.WorkflowAppService.WorkflowDefinitionMaxLength
properties.description:
The maximum length of the workflow definition in bytes
      An error will be reported if the length exceeds the given maximum

properties.name: oozie.service.ELService.ext.functions.workflow
properties.description:
EL functions declarations, separated by commas, format is [PREFIX:]NAME=CLASS#METHOD.
      This property is a convenience property to add extensions to the built in executors without having to
      include all the built in ones.

properties.description: EL constant declarations, separated by commas, format is [PREFIX:]NAME=CLASS#CONSTANT.

properties.description: EL functions declarations, separated by commas, format is [PREFIX:]NAME=CLASS#METHOD.

EL functions declarations, separated by commas, format is [PREFIX:]NAME=CLASS#METHOD.
      This property is a convenience property to add extensions to the built in executors without having to

properties.name: oozie.service.UUIDService.generator
properties.description:
random : generated UUIDs will be random strings.
      counter: generated UUIDs generated will be a counter postfixed with the system startup time.

properties.name: oozie.service.DBLiteWorkflowStoreService.status.metrics.collection.interval
properties.description: Workflow Status metrics collection interval in minutes.

properties.name: oozie.service.DBLiteWorkflowStoreService.status.metrics.window
properties.description: Workflow Status metrics collection window in seconds. Workflow status will be instrumented for the window.

properties.name: oozie.db.schema.name
properties.description: Oozie DataBase Name

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.create.db.schema
properties.description:
Creates Oozie DB.

      If set to true, it creates the DB schema if it does not exist. If the DB schema exists is a NOP.
      If set to false, it does not create the DB schema. If the DB schema does not exist it fails start up.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.validate.db.connection
properties.description:
Validates DB connections from the DB connection pool.
      If the 'oozie.service.JPAService.create.db.schema' property is set to true, this property is ignored.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.validate.db.connection.eviction.interval
properties.description:
Validates DB connections from the DB connection pool.
      When validate db connection 'TestWhileIdle' is true, the number of milliseconds to sleep
      between runs of the idle object evictor thread.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.validate.db.connection.eviction.num
properties.description:
Validates DB connections from the DB connection pool.
      When validate db connection 'TestWhileIdle' is true, the number of objects to examine during
      each run of the idle object evictor thread.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.connection.data.source
properties.description: DataSource to be used for connection pooling.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.jdbc.driver
properties.description: JDBC driver class.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.jdbc.url
properties.description: JDBC URL.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.jdbc.username
properties.description: DB user name.

properties.name: oozie.service.JPAService.pool.max.active.conn
properties.description: Max number of connections.

properties.name: oozie.service.SchemaService.wf.ext.schemas
properties.description:
Schemas for additional actions types.

      IMPORTANT: if there are no schemas leave a 1 space string, the service trims the value,
      if empty Configuration assumes it is NULL.

properties.name: oozie.service.SchemaService.coord.ext.schemas
properties.description:
Schemas for additional actions types.

      IMPORTANT: if there are no schemas leave a 1 space string, the service trims the value,
      if empty Configuration assumes it is NULL.

properties.name: oozie.service.CallbackService.base.url
properties.description: Base callback URL used by ActionExecutors.

properties.name: oozie.servlet.CallbackServlet.max.data.len
properties.description: Max size in characters for the action completion data output.

properties.name: oozie.external.stats.max.size
properties.description: Max size in bytes for action stats. -1 means infinite value.

properties.name: oozie.JobCommand.job.console.url
properties.description: Base console URL for a workflow job.

properties.name: oozie.service.ActionService.executor.classes
properties.description:
List of ActionExecutors classes (separated by commas).
      Only action types with associated executors can be used in workflows.

properties.name: oozie.service.ActionCheckerService.action.check.interval
properties.description: The frequency at which the ActionCheckService will run.

properties.name: oozie.service.ActionCheckerService.action.check.delay
properties.description: The time, in seconds, between an ActionCheck for the same action.

properties.name: oozie.service.ActionCheckerService.callable.batch.size
properties.description:
This value determines the number of actions which will be batched together
      to be executed by a single thread.

properties.name: oozie.service.StatusTransitService.statusTransit.interval
properties.description: The frequency in seconds at which the StatusTransitService will run.

properties.name: oozie.service.StatusTransitService.backward.support.for.coord.status
properties.description:
true, if coordinator job submits using 'uri:oozie:coordinator:0.1' namespace and wants to keep Oozie 2.x status
      transit.
      if set true,
      1. SUCCEEDED state in coordinator job means materialization done.
      2. No DONEWITHERROR state in coordinator job
      3. No PAUSED or PREPPAUSED state in coordinator job
      4. PREPSUSPENDED becomes SUSPENDED in coordinator job

properties.name: oozie.service.PauseTransitService.PauseTransit.interval
properties.description: The frequency in seconds at which the PauseTransitService will run.

properties.name: oozie.action.retries.max
properties.description: The number of retries for executing an action in case of failure

properties.name: oozie.action.hadoop.delete.hdfs.tmp.dir
properties.description: If set to true, it will delete temporary directory at the end of execution of map reduce action.

properties.name: oozie.action.pig.delete.hdfs.tmp.dir
properties.description: If set to true, it will delete temporary directory at the end of execution of pig action.

properties.name: oozie.action.ssh.delete.remote.tmp.dir
properties.description: If set to true, it will delete temporary directory at the end of execution of ssh action.

properties.name: oozie.action.ssh.http.command
properties.description:
Command to use for callback to oozie, normally is 'curl' or 'wget'.
      The command must available in PATH environment variable of the USER@HOST box shell.

properties.name: oozie.action.ssh.http.command.post.options
properties.description:
The callback command POST options.
      Used when the ouptut of the ssh action is captured.

properties.name: oozie.action.ssh.allow.user.at.host
properties.description:
Specifies whether the user specified by the ssh action is allowed or is to be replaced
      by the Job user

properties.name: oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.kerberos.enabled
properties.description: Indicates if Oozie is configured to use Kerberos.

properties.name: local.realm
properties.description: Kerberos Realm used by Oozie and Hadoop. Using 'local.realm' to be aligned with Hadoop configuration

properties.name: oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.keytab.file
properties.description: Location of the Oozie user keytab file.

properties.name: oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.kerberos.principal
properties.description: Kerberos principal for Oozie service.

properties.name: oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.hadoop.configurations
properties.description:
Comma separated AUTHORITY=HADOOP_CONF_DIR, where AUTHORITY is the HOST:PORT of
      the Hadoop service (JobTracker, YARN, HDFS). The wildcard '*' configuration is
      used when there is no exact match for an authority. The HADOOP_CONF_DIR contains
      the relevant Hadoop *-site.xml files. If the path is relative is looked within
      the Oozie configuration directory; though the path can be absolute (i.e. to point
      to Hadoop client conf/ directories in the local filesystem.

properties.name: oozie.service.HadoopAccessorService.action.configurations
properties.description:
Comma separated AUTHORITY=ACTION_CONF_DIR, where AUTHORITY is the HOST:PORT of
      the Hadoop MapReduce service (JobTracker, YARN). The wildcard '*' configuration is
      used when there is no exact match for an authority. The ACTION_CONF_DIR may contain
      ACTION.xml files where ACTION is the action type ('java', 'map-reduce', 'pig',
      'hive', 'sqoop', etc.). If the ACTION.xml file exists, its properties will be used
      as defaults properties for the action. If the path is relative is looked within
      the Oozie configuration directory; though the path can be absolute (i.e. to point
      to Hadoop client conf/ directories in the local filesystem.

properties.name: oozie.actions.main.classnames
properties.description: A list of class name mapping for Action classes

properties.name: oozie.service.WorkflowAppService.system.libpath
properties.description:
System library path to use for workflow applications.
      This path is added to workflow application if their job properties sets
      the property 'oozie.use.system.libpath' to true.

properties.name: use.system.libpath.for.mapreduce.and.pig.jobs
properties.description:
If set to true, submissions of MapReduce and Pig jobs will include
      automatically the system library path, thus not requiring users to
      specify where the Pig JAR files are. Instead, the ones from the system
      library path are used.

properties.name: oozie.command.default.lock.timeout
properties.description: Default timeout (in milliseconds) for commands for acquiring an exclusive lock on an entity.

properties.name: oozie.service.LiteWorkflowStoreService.user.retry.max
properties.description: Automatic retry max count for workflow action is 3 in default.

properties.name: oozie.service.LiteWorkflowStoreService.user.retry.inteval
properties.description: Automatic retry interval for workflow action is in minutes and the default value is 10 minutes.

properties.name: oozie.service.LiteWorkflowStoreService.user.retry.error.code
properties.description:
Automatic retry interval for workflow action is handled for these specified error code:
      FS009, FS008 is file exists error when using chmod in fs action.
      JA018 is output directory exists error in workflow map-reduce action.
      JA019 is error while executing distcp action.
      JA017 is job not exists error in action executor.
      JA008 is FileNotFoundException in action executor.
      JA009 is IOException in action executor.

properties.name: oozie.service.LiteWorkflowStoreService.node.def.version
properties.description: NodeDef default version, _oozie_inst_v_0 or _oozie_inst_v_1

properties.name: oozie.authentication.type
properties.description:
Defines authentication used for Oozie HTTP endpoint.
      Supported values are: simple | kerberos | #AUTHENTICATION_HANDLER_CLASSNAME#

properties.name: oozie.authentication.token.validity
properties.description:
Indicates how long (in seconds) an authentication token is valid before it has
      to be renewed.

properties.name: oozie.authentication.signature.secret
properties.description:
The signature secret for signing the authentication tokens.
      If not set a random secret is generated at startup time.
      In order to authentiation to work correctly across multiple hosts
      the secret must be the same across al the hosts.

properties.name: oozie.authentication.simple.anonymous.allowed
properties.description: Indicates if anonymous requests are allowed when using 'simple' authentication.

properties.name: oozie.authentication.kerberos.principal
properties.description:
Indicates the Kerberos principal to be used for HTTP endpoint.
      The principal MUST start with 'HTTP/' as per Kerberos HTTP SPNEGO specification.

properties.name: oozie.authentication.kerberos.keytab
properties.description:
Location of the keytab file with the credentials for the principal.
      Referring to the same keytab file Oozie uses for its Kerberos credentials for Hadoop.

properties.name: oozie.authentication.kerberos.name.rules
properties.description:
The kerberos names rules is to resolve kerberos principal names, refer to Hadoop's
      KerberosName for more details.

properties.name: oozie.coord.actions.default.length
properties.description: Default number of coordinator actions to be retrieved by the info command

properties.name: oozie.validate.ForkJoin
properties.description: If true, fork and join should be validated at wf submission time.

properties.name: oozie.coord.action.get.all.attributes
properties.description:
Setting to true is not recommended as coord job/action info will bring all columns of the action in memory.
      Set it true only if backward compatibility for action/job info is required.
